instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00164: What is 820-00164? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.D7012: What is D7012? Diode between ground and gate of Q7010 on 2013-2015 year model macbook airs, necessary for Q7010 to allow PPDCIN_G3H to flow through to PP3V42_G3H power supply input. When this diode dies or corrodes, PP3V42_G3H input will not have any voltage, and chargers will not turn on. This can often be the problem if a system only works with a knockoff charger/bench power supply. .
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.R7005: What is R7005? resistor between charger and CHGR_DCIN pin of ISL6259, if CHGR_DCIN is low then this resistor is probably blown. When PPBUS_G3H is low or missing this is something to check if your model has CHGR_DCIN along R7005. .
definitions.R7151: What is R7151? Current sense resistor between battery current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7152: What is R7152? Current sense resistor between battery current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.C7125: What is C7125? Capacitor between CHGR_BOOT and CHGR_PHASE important for bootstrapping creation of PPBUS_G3H on 2013-2015 macbook pros.
definitions.Q7180: What is Q7180? Inrush limiter transistor that must be told by the ISL6259 that it is safe to allow charger voltage to pass through to the computer. This needs CHGR_AGATE and CHGR_SGATE to be pulled down in order for it to close and allow voltage through to the system, current sensing failures as well as ISL6259 failures can cause this to happen. .
definitions.Q7010: What is Q7010? Q7010 controls whether or not PPDCIN_G3H will be let through to the PP3V42_G3H power supply, often this circuit area is not working because D7010 has died or corroded. .
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.3V42_G3H: What is 3V42_G3H? This is shorthand for PP3V42_G3H which is one of the first power rails that must turn on in older Macbooks that use a magsafe charger in order for them to get a light on the charger. This power rail powers the onewire circuit and the SMC, which are necessary for the machine to communicate with the charger and get it to turn on, as well as begin the bootup sequence. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> PPBUS 3.2V
threads.message:
Clean board, already replaced <TRANSISTOR>Q7180</TRANSISTOR> (2 times), <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>, <DIODE>D7005</DIODE>, <TRANSISTOR>Q7010</TRANSISTOR>, <DIODE>D7012</DIODE>, <CAPACITOR>C7125</CAPACITOR>

<RESISTOR>R7005</RESISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R7006</RESISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R7152</RESISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R7151</RESISTOR>, <SIGNAL>SMBUS_SDL</SIGNAL> and SCL are all fine.

Testing with original 45W and fake 85W same thing.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> PPBUS 3.2V
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> PPBUS 3.2V
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> PPBUS 3.2V
threads.message:
Post <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> basic voltages: 1, 2, 3, 9, 12, 13, 14, 15, 17, 18, 19, 20, 27.

Do you get <SIGNAL>3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> PPBUS 3.2V
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> Present

<CHIP>U7100</CHIP> basic voltages with original 45W adapter and F7140 installed:
1 0
2 15
3 3.9
9 0
12 3.4
13 3.3
14 3.3
15 0
17 3.2
18 3.2
19 3.2
20 5
27 15

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> PPBUS 3.2V
threads.message:
"19 3.2"
I doubt; check it again.

Is <CAPACITOR>C7125</CAPACITOR> good; replace it, just in case.
Be sure all traces and solders are good in the area.

You can also try replacing <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR>.

<RESISTOR>R7100</RESISTOR> is OK?
Post exact ohm resistance between pins 17/18 & 27/28.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> PPBUS 3.2V
threads.message:
<CHIP>U7100</CHIP> basic voltages with original 45W adapter and F7140 installed:
1 0
2 15
3 3.9
9 0
12 3.4
13 3.3
14 3.3
15 0
17 3.2
18 3.2
19 5
20 5
27 15

<CAPACITOR>C7125</CAPACITOR> was replaced and before or after same result.

<TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR> was it, thanks a lot!
